intro: Pilosella ingrica, commonly known as the slender pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence. Pilosella ingrica typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive appearance, and it is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
